column4: Why can't I upgrade to 11.04 from terminal? I am typing the right commands: sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
Am i missig somethig?
Oh, thank you
my bad
sudo apt-get update ; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
They say that's NOT the right command
What command?
dist-upgrade, it's do-release-upgrade
Ok, well, they both prolly work still
Sure
There is a plugin for Firefox someplace, but I don't know the name of it.  Just look around.
Na, they tend to fail, it's a 600MB file, and it stoped at 90MB, i want something to download and try everytime there is a bad internet connection
Text editors use fonts and even though they are owned by root, they are still accessable.
I think you are barking up the wrong tree.  There is some other reason the fonts are not accessable.  You need to look at the information that was provided to you by ubottu
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Fonts
This may be off topic just a bit, but did you run checksum?
Nah, it didn't have any MD5sum on its web page
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UbuntuHashes
I never burn a CD without verifying the integrity of the iso.
Since it is based on Ubuntu, is it ok to check the sum there? and if so, what version should i check?
There is a particular hash for each particular iso
